neuron_network

Class MultilayerPerceptron

  • java.lang.Object
    • neuron_network.MultilayerPerceptron

  • public class MultilayerPerceptron
extends java.lang.Object
    The MultilayerPerceptron class defines a NeuronNetwork that organizes the neurons by layers.

    Usually this network will need almost 3 layers, but it can be higher if needed.

    The first layer is called the input layer, because is the layer that will store the network's input at a given moment. This layer has no processing in the given inputs.

    Last layer is called output layer, because it determines the output of the neuron network for a specific input.

    The rest of the layers are called hidden layers, because you don't have real control over them. They make an process over the data to try to determine an accurate output in the output layer.

    Hidden layers are the most useful part of the Neuron Network, because they can process the info in the input layer and try to make an accurate prediction.

    Version:
    1.0.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean use_bias
      A flag to config the network to use neurons with bias or without bias.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultilayerPerceptron()
      Basic constructor.
      MultilayerPerceptron(int hidden_layers, int hidden_neurons, int output_neurons)
      It initializes the neuron network with the specified number of hidden layers, with the specified number of neurons in each hidden layer and the specified number of output neurons in the output layer.

    • Field Detail

      • use_bias

        public boolean use_bias
        A flag to config the network to use neurons with bias or without bias. When true it will use neurons with bias.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultilayerPerceptron

        public MultilayerPerceptron()
        Basic constructor. It initializes a simple neuron network with one input in the inputs layer, one hidden layer with one neuron and one neuron in the output layer.

      • MultilayerPerceptron

        public MultilayerPerceptron(int hidden_layers,
                            int hidden_neurons,
                            int output_neurons)
        It initializes the neuron network with the specified number of hidden layers, with the specified number of neurons in each hidden layer and the specified number of output neurons in the output layer.
        Parameters:
        hidden_layers - the number of hidden layers
        hidden_neurons - the number of hidden neurons in each hidden_layer
        output_neurons - the number of output neurons in the output layer

    • Method Detail

      • setHiddenLayersSize

        public void setHiddenLayersSize(int n_hidden_layers,
                                int n_neurons)
        It sets the number of hidden layers to the specified n_hidden_layers. Also it add n_neurons in each layer. It resets all layers, so saved data will be deleted
        Parameters:
        n_hidden_layers - The number of hidden layers to be sets
        n_neurons - The number of neurons in each hidden layer.

      • feed

        public void feed(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> inputs)
        It feeds the network with the inputs given. You can use without problems the inputs array because it won't affect to the neuron network.
        Parameters:
        inputs - the list of inputs to the neuron network

      • getOutputs

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getOutputs()
        It returns the output layer.
        Returns:
        a copy of the actual outputs of the neuron.

      • setLearningFactor

        public void setLearningFactor(double learning_value)
        It sets the value of the learning factor. This value must be a double between 0 and 1 otherwise will throw a InvalidArgumentException
        Parameters:
        learning_value - the value of the learning param
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the learning_value is not between 0 and 1

      • getLearningFactor

        public double getLearningFactor()
        It returns the current learning factor of the neuron network
        Returns:
        the learning factor of the neuron network

      • setInertiaValue

        public void setInertiaValue(double inertia_value)
        It sets the value of the inertia. This value must be a double between 0 and 1 otherwise will throw a IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        inertia_value - the new inertia value of the neuron network
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the inertia is not between 0 and 1

        Returns:

        It gets the current input
        Returns:
        the current input in the network

      • spreadOut

        public void spreadOut()
        It spread out the inputs from the input layer to the output layer

      • setNeuronInputs

        public boolean setNeuronInputs(int layer_index,
                               int neuron_index,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> inputs)
        It sets the specified inputs on the specified layer. To take effect, the inputs given must have the same length than the inputs of the neuron. Otherwise this method will not make anything.
        Parameters:
        layer_index - the index of the hidden layer to set the inputs or a negative value if it is the output layer
        neuron_index - the index of the neuron inside the layer where to set the inputs
        inputs - the inputs to set
        Returns:
        a true value if the values were set or false otherwise.

      • getNeuronInputs

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getNeuronInputs(int layer_index,
                                                             int neuron_index)
        It returns the inputs of the specified neuron in the specified layer.
        Parameters:
        layer_index - the index of the layer where the neuron is of a negative value to search in the output layer
        neuron_index - the index of the neuron inside the layer
        Returns:
        the array with the inputs of the neuron.

      • getNeuronInputsSize

        public int getNeuronInputsSize(int layer_index,
                               int neuron_index)
        It returns the size of the inputs in the specified neuron.
        Parameters:
        layer_index - the index where the neuron is or a negative index to seach in the output layer
        neuron_index - the index of the neuron inside the layer.
        Returns:
        the size of the inputs in the neuron

        Parameters:
        layer_index - the index where the neuron is or a negative index to search in the output layer
        neuron_index - the index of the neuron inside the layer
        bias - the bias value to be set.

      • getMeanSquaredError

        public double getMeanSquaredError(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> desired)
        It returns the error of the current network's output if the desired output is desired
        Parameters:
        desired - the desired output for the neuron network
        Returns:
        the MSE of the current output

      • getMeanSquaredError

        public double getMeanSquaredError(NetworkData data)
        It returns the mean error of the network with each patron in data. It spread out all data, so you don't need to do it before
        Parameters:
        data - a NetworkData with all patrons to be tested
        Returns:
        the mean of all MSE of all patrons.

      • applySoftmax

        public void applySoftmax()
        It applies a softmax function to the current outputs in the outputs layer.

      • setRandomInputs

        public void setRandomInputs()
        It sets all inputs at random between -1 and 1. Note: the random generator used by the class is a strong generator that generate truly random number. For this reason is not easy to retreive the seed used to generate random number and set a random seed wont work.

      • getLayerSize

        public int getLayerSize(int layer_index)
        It retrives the number of neurons in the specified layer. You can use -1 as index to retrieve the number of neurons in the output layer
        Parameters:
        layer_index - the index of the layer to select.
        Returns:
        the size of the layer

      • getOutput

        public double getOutput(int index)
        It returns the outputs at th specified index
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the output to be retrieved
        Returns:
        the output value at index in the outputs layer

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        It converts the network in a string. Ready to be printed
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the neuron network as a string

      • onlineBackpropagation

        public void onlineBackpropagation(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> input,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> desiredOutput)

        It makes a online back propagation trying to improve the neuron network result for the given neuron.

        Because all neuron coefficients will change after this, please, don't forget to call to spreadOut

        Parameters:
        input - the input to the neuron network
        desiredOutput - the output desired for the given input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - desiredOutput length is not equal to the length of the output layer

      • trainByBackpropagation

        public double[] trainByBackpropagation(NetworkData trainData,
                                       NetworkData testData,
                                       int maxiter,
                                       double minimumImprovement,
                                       java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Double> trainListener)
        It trains the network data with the data given as train_data and check it's capacity with the data given as test_data.
        Parameters:
        trainData - data to be used in the training process
        testData - data to be used in the test process
        maxiter - max number of iterations in the training process
        minimumImprovement - minimum improvement to continue the training
        trainListener - a Consumer that receives current training error
        Returns:
        an double Array with two elements where first element is train error and last element is test error
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if desiredOutput's length in data is not equal to the length of the output layer

      • trainByBackpropagation

        public double[] trainByBackpropagation(NetworkData trainData,
                                       NetworkData testData,
                                       int maxiter,
                                       double minimumImprovement)
        It trains the network data with the data given as train_data and check it's capacity with the data given as test_data.
        Parameters:
        trainData - data to be used in the training process
        testData - data to be used in the test process
        maxiter - max number of iterations in the training process
        minimumImprovement - minimum improvement to continue the training
        Returns:
        an double Array with two elements where first element is train error and last element is test error
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if desiredOutput's length in data is not equal to the length of the output layer

      • clearOutput

        protected void clearOutput()
        It clears the outputs in the output layer

      • setOutputLayerSize

        public void setOutputLayerSize(int n_neurons)
        It initializes the number the outputs in the output layer. It also reset the layer.
        Parameters:
        n_neurons - the number of neurons to set in the output layer

      • checkAndCorrectConnectorsBetweenInputAndHiddenLayer

        protected void checkAndCorrectConnectorsBetweenInputAndHiddenLayer()
        It checks and correct the connectors between input layer and the first hidden layer. Usually must be called with each feed.

      • checkAndCorrectConnectorsOfHiddenLayers

        protected void checkAndCorrectConnectorsOfHiddenLayers()
        It checks and correct the connector between hidden layers and between last hidden layer and output layer. Usually must be called once, when you change the structure of network.

      • checkAndCorrectConnectorsBetweenHiddenAndOutputLayer

        protected void checkAndCorrectConnectorsBetweenHiddenAndOutputLayer()
        It checks and correct the connectors between hidden layers and output layers

      • checkAndConnectAllLayers

        protected void checkAndConnectAllLayers()
        It checks and connect all layers

      • getNeuron

        protected Neuron getNeuron(int layer_index,
                           int neuron_index)
        It selects a neuron and return its reference.
        Parameters:
        layer_index - the index of the hidden layer where is the neuron or a negative index to select it from output layer
        neuron_index - the index inside the layer where is the neuron.
        Returns:
        the neuron specified

      • updateDeltas

        protected void updateDeltas(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> desiredOutput)
        It will update the deltas of each neuron in the network to register the change that must do the neuron to each input in order to improve his output
        Parameters:
        desiredOutput - the output desired by the neuron network

      • setInputChangesToZero

        protected void setInputChangesToZero()
        Sets all input changes to zero

      • updateInputChanges

        protected void updateInputChanges()
        It updates the input changes to improve the neuron output

      • adjustWeights

        protected void adjustWeights()
        It will adjusts the weights of the inputs in the neuron network
